acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=220microg/L of fishes (Rainbow trout) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Since particulate aerosol inhalation LC50 of rat was 0.5 or less in 4-hour translation, it was set as Category 2.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: From rat oral LD50=1325mg/kg: average of male and female (ACGIH(2004)), it was set as Category 4 .

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is no laboratory reports which suggests carcinogenic. And ACGIH had made the judgment of A4. It carried out "Category Outside."

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=2.76(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_aerosols.rationale: Although it could be used as an aerosol, this evaluation is done with "solid" of the bulk substance.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since it gave negative in micronucleus test with mice bone marrow cells (ACGIH (2001)), we classified it as "Out Of Category." In addition, in the in vitro test, we found a positive report for the chromosome aberrations which used CHO (NTP TR377 (1990)).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine) and the chlorine is chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: There is no information that it ignites spontaneously.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: There is no effect in the inhalation exposure test to pregnancy rat and rabbit (ACGIH (2001)), but there is no exposure test data before mating. Data is insufficient and it cannot be classified.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Since there is no information on respiratory sensitization, it cannot be classified.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is tear effect and it is used for mobs suppression. However, a sequelae does not remain and it was set as "Category 2B" by that which is judged in the experiment of the rabbit to be Mild (RTECS (2004)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since there was a result of Mild in skin application test on rodent (RTECS (2004)), it was classified as "Category 3."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since there is a report on skin sensitization(ACGIH (2001)) that the skin sensitization was observed in workers at the manufacturing site, it was referred to as  Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There was no harmful effects which needs particular reference in long-term (2W) low concentration exposure (ACGIH (2001)). Since it is data of the intraperitoneal administration, animal studies reports of adverse effects is not adopted. Since the effects on the respiratory system was taken up by single exposure, repeated exposure was considered "Outside Category."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In addition to the lachrymal action, the influence (temporary ?) on the respiratory system is reported by the experiment by a human volunteer (ACGIH (2001)). Also by the animal experiments, in the range of a Category 1 guidance value, the effects on the respiratory system was reported. So it was set as "Category 1 (respiratory tracts)." Therefore, it is not adopted as Category although there may be a respiratory irritation.
